page.title: 09WHITLEY
page.content: Whitley is a village on the wool pack route into Lancashire.Drivers used to rest at the{Woolpack Inn}and horses could be shod at the blacksmiths nearby.The building which housed the blacksmiths forge can still be seen.A small coal mine existed near the village and a distribution depot was close at hand.The depot is still used but the mine is derelict.Whitley Church was built in 1847 and the present school soon afterwards.The village identity is secure in the future due to the green belt.No new houses can be built in the village.This also means that no new families are moving in and this is the major factor in the school's falling roll crisis.There is a mixture of housing types and designs in the village.
